content: Acknowledged. Individuals can apply to NCAT to make certain decisions, review decisions, or resolve a dispute. NCAT deals with a wide range of everyday issues and disputes, including resolving disputes about tenancy and building works, decisions about guardianship, and administrative review of government decisions. The application process can vary for different types of cases, and time limits may apply. To start proceedings at NCAT, individuals will need to complete an application form and lodge it with the appropriate fee. All NCAT application forms are available for download in PDF-fillable format, and some application types can be completed online. Information required on the application includes the names and contact details of both parties, the orders being sought, and the reasons why those orders are requested. If the case is about an urgent issue, parties should find out how to apply for an urgent hearing. An application fee may be payable depending on the case type, and a reduced concession fee is available for eligible persons. Time limits may also apply, and parties should check if time limits apply by reading the information for their type of case. If the other party is a business or company, individuals must provide the name of the individual or company that owns the business, the registered name and address, and their ABN or ACN, and a business name or company extract must be provided to NCAT. If the other party in the case is a permanent resident in another State, the application may be affected by federal jurisdiction.
